result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Maurice Dee McNeal

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Maurice Dee McNeal appeared by video.  Attorney Joseph P Bastien V appeared by video for Maurice Dee McNeal.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense counsel has received discovery and has not received an offer.
State informed the Court that this case may be eligible for deferred prosecution agreement and requests defendant schedule TAD evaluation.
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 30.
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 091172,
Payable Number: 1034108,
Receipt Number: 22RP038268,
Amount: $20.00

ADDRESS INFO for Maurice Dee McNeal
Current: 6033 W Birch Ave., Milwaukee, WI 53218 United States  (Effective: 08-18-2022)
Prior: 3319 South 99Th Court #5, Milwaukee, WI 53227

Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. 
No driving without a valid license.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Reserve Judge, Branch 13.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Richards, Br. 30.

Defendant Maurice Dee McNeal in court.  Attorney Joseph P Bastien V in court for Maurice Dee McNeal.  Prosecuting attorney Foley J. Van Lieshout Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised this case is substituted to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 30.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 9/7/22 @ 2:30p
